intro: Epilobium ursinum, commonly known as wolf willow or rosebay willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy pink to red flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Epilobium ursinum is often found in moist habitats such as riverbanks, ditches, and woodland edges. It has been used historically in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
